Hello, I am Jisu

a UXUI designer expereinced in front-end development focused on creating design systems for better digital expereiecnces.

I studied Digital Interactive Art at Emily Carr University. I began my career as a web product designer in the marketing department. My tasks involved delivering web-related products such as websites, marketing ads, event pages, etc. To enhance my UX design skills and communication abilities, I learned programming and marketing. After taking some courses, I built two web applications during my free time and also completed some projects as freelancer. Now, I am working as a UX/UI designer in the game industry. I enjoy solving problems in across various industries.

Design Skills
  • User resarch
  • UX design - Holistic view of an interconnected system
  • Problem sloution
  • Storyboard
  • Information artichture (Draw.io)
  • Prototyping (Figma, XD, Invision)
  • Product design (Figma, XD)
  • Graphic design (Photoshop)
Programming Skills
  • Transferring design to functional prototypes using code
  • HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, Java, Unreal Engine, Unity, Perforce, Git
  • Good understand of web APIs and data fetching capabilities.
  • Always interested in new technologies
Marketing Skills
  • Google Analytics
  • SEO (and how it affects the user retention rates)
  • Keywords research by personas
  • Understanding and driving results to meet KPIs

My Design Principles

Strong conviction

Showing numbers helps to support the design and convince stakeholders therefore I find the data that can support my design. (It can be competitor's profit numbers, user conversion rate, users reviews/ feedbacks, etc.)

Thoughtful Complexity

I enjoy delving into complex challenges that require deep product thinking. Sometimes, I gather ideas from unrelated products, so I consistently keep an eye on every app or web product I use. Additionally, collaborating with others helps in solving complex problems.

Process Oriented

After becoming a UX/UI designer, I shifted my focus to being more process-oriented. I collaborate closely with my teammates to establish processes that benefit both our teams and users. This involves maintaining flexibility and adaptability to adjust priorities and outcomes as needed.

Favorite books

To gain a deeper understanding, I consistently seek new knowledge. The following books was especially useful and interesting: "The Design of Everyday Things," "What Silicon Valley Does and Develops" by Chan Han, "1-10 Steps of UX and Product Planning Guide," and "Sell or Be Sold." One of my advantages is that I can access valuable UX/UI books written in both Korean and English. This helps me stay informed and informed about UX trends in various contexts.
